summary:
Go is an old Chinese board game for two players. The goal is to control more space on the board than your opponent. Players take turns placing stones on the intersections, trying to surround the enemy's stones. The game has simple rules but is very complex, with many possible moves.

It is believed to be the oldest board game still played today, with millions of players worldwide, mostly in East Asia. The game's popularity has spread, and it is now enjoyed globally. Go is known for its strategic depth, often compared to chess but with even more possibilities.
title: Go (game)
